item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 24, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A Career Ending Mistake (199 points | 111 comments)
2. Those Correction Notices, in Full (55 points | 8 comments)
3. Mark–Scavenge: Waiting for Trash to Take Itself Out (29 points | 1 comment)
4. I made an ls alternative for my personal use it turned out to be amazing (25 points | 17 comments)
5. Full LLM training and evaluation toolkit (61 points | 3 comments)
6. Howstuffworks.com creator, Marshall Brain, has died (154 points | 33 comments)
7. History of Hangul (38 points | 15 comments)
8. NASA: Mystery of Life's Handedness Deepens (8 points | 2 comments)
9. Frosted Glass from Games to the Web: HTML glass UI inspired by AAA game dev (615 points | 143 comments)
10. WireGuard: Beyond the Most Basic Configuration (6 points | discuss)
11. Linux 6.13 Will Report the Number of Hung Tasks Since Boot (70 points | 7 comments)
12. Petnames: A humane approach to secure, decentralized naming (26 points | 1 comment)
13. Deegen: A JIT-Capable VM Generator for Dynamic Languages (61 points | 7 comments)
14. Evidence of oldest known alphabetic writing unearthed in ancient Syrian city (315 points | 228 comments)
15. Bocker: Docker implemented in around 100 lines of Bash (2015) (336 points | 94 comments)
16. The Flavour of Mechanisation (7 points | discuss)
17. Open-interpreter: A natural language interface for computers (27 points | 4 comments)
18. Jiga (YC W21) Is Hiring Operations Coordinator ( | hide)
19. Which Power Plant Does My Electricity Come From? (146 points | 68 comments)
20. How to give a senior leader feedback without getting fired (335 points | 287 comments)
21. New study shows: EV batteries last much longer than expected (17 points | 1 comment)
22. Judge Rules in Favor of School That Gave Student a Bad Grade for Using AI (11 points | 12 comments)
23. Undersea Cables Connect the Global Internet (40 points | 15 comments)
24. Tweaking non-neural brain cells can cause memories to fade (18 points | 1 comment)
25. Antenna Diodes in the Pentium Processor (235 points | 38 comments)
26. A 132-Year-Old Message in a Bottle in a Scottish Lighthouse (69 points | 40 comments)
27. Three hundred words you can spell on a calculator [pdf] (90 points | 33 comments)
28. The 'giant' river crabs that live beneath Rome's ancient ruins (44 points | 7 comments)
29. Robot Jailbreak: Researchers Trick Bots into Dangerous Tasks (62 points | 25 comments)
30. Volunteer DEF CON hackers dive into America's leaky water infrastructure (20 points | 3 comments)
